page.title: 02EGLOSKERRY SCHOOL 1935 1985
page.content: Our records go back to 1935 when a building was on the same site as now but was nearer to the road.It was made of wood,had two rooms and there were about 30 children and 2 teachers It was heated by two coal burning stoves.The age groups were from 5 to 14 years.By 1939 the senior boys went to Launceston for their woodwork lessons.There was no water available for washing in the school.Drinking water had to be fetched from some distance.In 1954 the school which had been a mixed all age school,became a Junior Mixed School.Seven boys and five girls were transferred to the Launceston New Modern School.In September school dinners were served for the first time.They were cooked at Pennygillam in Launceston.In 1957 a cess pit with concrete walls and iron and concrete cover was built.(Cont.p3)
